column1: Having considered  these  infirmities  in the dock  statement, the  trial
Court had correctly rejected  it as a false  one.  Before it ventured to  analyse
the  statement,  the  trial  Court  reminded  itself  as  to  the  applicable  legal

principles 
in  relation 
to  evaluation  of  dock  statements  and 
the 
three

positions 
it  must  consider.  We 
see  no  misapplication  of  any 
legal

principles  or  an 
illegal 
imposition  of  an  evidentiary  burden  on 
the
Accused- Appellant with regard to contents of his dock statement.
